args.natural_language_statement: Let n>0 be an integer and let a,b in Z. Prove that a ≡ b (mod n) iff a and b have the same remainder upon division by n. Translate into Lean4 statement only (no proof). The Lean statement should import Mathlib and end with := by sorry.

retrieved_examples.nl: If a ≡ b (mod n) then n divides a-b
retrieved_examples.lean: theorem congr_mod_dvd (n : Int) (a b : Int) : n ∣ (a - b) := by sorry

retrieved_examples.nl: An integer has a unique remainder r with 0 ≤ r < n when divided by positive n
retrieved_examples.lean: theorem exists_unique_remainder (n : Int) (hn : 0 < n) (a : Int) : ∃! (r : Int), 0 ≤ r ∧ r < n ∧ ∃ (q : Int), a = q * n + r := by sorry

open Function

/-- Let n>0 be an integer and let a,b in Z. Prove that a ≡ b (mod n) iff a and b have the same remainder upon division by n. Translate into Lean4 statement only (no proof). The Lean statement should import Mathlib and end with := by sorry. -/
theorem modEq_iff_mod_eq_lean (n : ℤ) (hn : 0 < n) (a b : ℤ) : a ≡ b [ZMOD n] ↔ a % n = b % n := by sorry"}

import Mathlib
open Function

/-- Let n>0 be an integer and let a,b in Z. Prove that a ≡ b (mod n) iff a and b have the same remainder upon division by n. -/
theorem modEq_iff_mod_eq_lean (n : ℤ) (hn : 0 < n) (a b : ℤ) : a ≡ b [ZMOD n] ↔ a % n = b % n := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Let n>0 be an integer and let a,b in Z. Prove that a ≡ b (mod n) iff a and b have the same remainder upon division by n. -/
theorem mod_eq_iff_mod_eq_remainder (n : Int) (hn : 0 < n) (a b : Int) : a ≡ b [ZMOD n] ↔ a % n = b % n := by sorry
